name: Skellig Michael
tagline: Ancient monastery on a dramatic Atlantic island
managedBy: Office of Public Works - Heritage Ireland

description.short: A UNESCO World Heritage Site featuring a remarkably preserved 6th-8th century monastic settlement perched 180 metres above the Atlantic Ocean.
description.full: Skellig Michael is one of Ireland's most extraordinary heritage sites, located 11.6 kilometres off the Kerry coast. This rocky island rises 218 metres above the Atlantic and is home to one of the world's best-preserved early Christian monastic settlements.
description.history: Founded between 6th-8th centuries by monks seeking spiritual isolation. Raided by Vikings in 823 and 838 AD. Continuously occupied until 12th-13th century. Featured as Luke Skywalker's exile location in Star Wars films.
description.significance: UNESCO World Heritage Site representing extremes of Christian monasticism. Outstanding example of early religious settlement on a pyramidal ocean rock.

directions.general: Accessible only by boat from Portmagee or Ballinskelligs. 11.6 km off the Iveragh Peninsula.
directions.publicTransport: Boat access only. Journey time 45-50 minutes each way.

admissionPrices.notes: Landing tour price includes boat transfer and 2.5 hours on island. Children under 12 not permitted. Book 6-12 months in advance.

visitingInformation.adviceForVisitors: CRITICAL: 618 steep steps. Requires excellent fitness. Children under 12 NOT permitted. Wear hiking boots. Weather cancellations extremely common.

highlights: Two boat-shaped oratories and medieval church
Second-largest gannet colony in world on Little Skellig

accessibility.accessibilityNotes: One of the most physically challenging heritage sites. Only suitable for fit, able-bodied adults and teenagers over 12.
